resources.string: Learn the goal and rules of Sudoku.

The goal of Sudoku is to fill a 9x9 grid with numbers so that each row, column and 3x3 section contain all of the digits between 1 and 9.

 1. **Row**: A horizontal line of 9 cells.
 2. **Column**: A vertical line of 9 cells.
 3. **Box**: A 3x3 sub-grid area.

 At the beginning of the game, the 9x9 grid will have some of the squares filled in. You cannot change these initial numbers.

This is the most basic strategy. When you look at a specific cell, check its Row, Column, and Box.

 If 8 different numbers already exist in these areas combined, the current cell MUST be the remaining 9th number.

 Example: If a row has 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8, the empty spot must be 9.
Finding where a number must go.

Instead of looking at a cell, look at a number (e.g., "1"). Focus on a 3x3 Box.

 Check the rows and columns passing through that box. If they already contain a "1", those positions in the box are blocked.

 If only one cell remains in that box that isn't blocked, that cell MUST contain the "1".

Most Sudoku apps focus only on solving puzzles, but I wanted to create something different. Sudoku Genius was born from the idea that logic is a skill that can be taught.\n\n Designed with a focus on clean UI and educational value, this app aims to help players understand the "Why" behind every move, transforming beginners into masters through practice and learning.
